page.title: 04Melanie's Day, Kidderminster
page.content: I get up and go outside. We have a large playground where we can play games. I go to the shops across the road; we have a Cooperative Society, a Betting Shop, Fish and Chip Shop, a Hairdresser's, a Post Office/Newsagent's and an Off-Licence which opens from 6.00 till 10.30 p.m. Nearby there is a recreation ground called Brinton's Park, donated by the Brinton family, who own large carpet factories in the town. In the park there is a paddling pool, a football pitch and a Bowling Green. On Sutton Farm Estate we have a resident's association which takes us on day trips. During the evening, at certain times of the year I am able to go to the travelling fair which stays at Worcester Road traffic island.
